117891.name: Das Ligretto Fußballspiel
117891.description:
Das Ligretto Fußballspiel combines the quick card play of Ligretto with Europe's favorite sport. To win the game, a player or team must be the first to score five goals.

To set up each match, players shuffle their deck of sixty cards, their goal cards, and the communal set of 24 field cards. They lay out five fields cards in a row to create the playing surface; each field card has a number on it. Each player randomly chooses one of his goal cards and places it face-down at one end of the field. Each goal card has a 1 on it. Players then get their cards and wait for the whistle.

At the same time, players start going through their decks, one card at a time. If a card is unplayable, the player places it face-up in one of two reserve stacks in front of him. A card is playable or not based on this restriction: Moving from left to right, players first need to play a 1 to cover their own goal, then they must play one or more cards that sum to the value on the leftmost field card. Once that card is covered, they play one or more cards that sum to the value on that field card. And so on.

When a player reaches the opponent's goal, he flips over that goal card to reveal a picture of a goalie and a ball entering the net. He then needs to mix together all of his discards and played cards, flip them over, and start looking card-by-card for four cards that can be fit together puzzle-style to resemble the picture on the back of the goal card. The first player to do this scores a goal and keeps the opponent's goal card; if he made a mistake anywhere, he scored an own goal, so the opponent gets a goal card from him.

Players then shuffle the cards and go at it once again. The first player to score five goals wins!

117892.name: Gildenbrief (Issue 9 - Mar 1987)
rpgpublisher: Verlag für Fantasy- und Science Fiction-Spiele
117892.description: This issue contains new encounters and one new spell. Also an article about madness and its consequences. Another article is about the gods and one article about torture in roleplay.

117893.name: Arkana Miłości: Kochankowie
117893.description:
The Lovers is the first expansion set for the Arcana of Love card game. It provides additional "spicy" cards for the erotic game for couples.

Components:

• 1 ARCANA card
• 4 ASSET cards
• 3 DARE cards
• 3 SPECIAL ACTION cards
• 13 ACTION card
• The Arcana of Love Cuffs
• The Arcana of Love Scarf
• Vibrator "Lady Finger"
• 2 Erotic Perfume Candles
• 1 Red Feather

117894.name: Gildenbrief (Issue 10 - Jun 1987)
rpgpublisher: Verlag für Fantasy- und Science Fiction-Spiele
117894.description: This issue contains the first part of the article "Zwischen zwei Abenteuern" which is about what can happen between some adventures. It also contains 2 new spells.

117895.name: Animaux et Réserves de France
117895.description:
Attractive trivia game, centred around the players' knowledge of animals within the regions of France. The six areas deemed to have these animals resident in them, are Vanoise, Corse, Pyrénées, Camargue, Armorique and Lorraine.

Each player receives animal tiles which act like jigsaw puzzle pieces i.e. they fit onto the board thus filling the map-board of France. To place a piece you must answer a question correctly. The questions, of course, are related to the subject of the game. First to place all their pieces, wins.

117896.name: Gildenbrief (Issue 11 - Aug 1987)
rpgpublisher: Verlag für Fantasy- und Science Fiction-Spiele
117896.description:
In this issue an article about critical hits and their consequences. The second part of "Zwischen zwei Abenteuern".
This issue also contains one new spell.

117897.name: Gildenbrief (Issue 12 - Dec 1987)
rpgpublisher: Verlag für Fantasy- und Science Fiction-Spiele
117897.description: This issue contains a big article about the setting round the Midgard country Erainn, also an article about being a good GM and an interview with Jürgen E. Franke

117898.name: Gildenbrief (Issue 13 - Apr 1988)
rpgpublisher: Verlag für Fantasy- und Science Fiction-Spiele
117898.description: Another article about the country Erainn and its law and green magic. Also contains an article about languages and an adventure "Ein aufregendes See- Abenteuer"

117899.name: Gildenbrief (Issue 14 - Jul 1988)
rpgpublisher: Verlag für Fantasy- und Science Fiction-Spiele
117899.description: This issue contains the adventure for the Gilgamesch Epos campaign. An article for an magical communication artifact. The issue also contains 2 new spells.

117900.name: Feu Rouge Feu Vert
117900.description:
Educational game about identifying road signs and observing road safety.

The track is ingeniously designed, going over and under itself at key points. Movement is by dice. At certain points on the track you must answer a question. The answer is hidden from you but if you place a transparent device over it, it becomes visible. You must get a question right to proceed. The first player to reach the end of the track, wins

117901.name: Georami
117901.description:
Educational game about the geography of France. It has a board showing all the separate regions of the country, but it is really a card game,

Three 'Contracts' are revealed. The contract might say "Regions that begin with the same letter", that sort of thing. Each player has 10 cards and can claim a contract if you reveal the cards asked for. Each contract is worth points - easy to do might be 3 points, more difficult 6 points, very difficult 10 points. When a contract is taken another one replaces it.

The first player to obtain 10 contracts scores the points on each contract, plus two points for each contract that another player has less then ten, plus 20 points for going out first. The player with the highest score, wins.

117902.name: Gildenbrief (Issue 15 - Jan 1989)
rpgpublisher: Verlag für Fantasy- und Science Fiction-Spiele
117902.description:
first issue with illustrations, last A5 issue.

This issue contains an alternative system for experience points. A new magical artifact and 3 new spells. It contains also an article about to integrate the players in roleplay for a better group feeling.
The Gilgamesch-Epos II is the second part of the Solo adventure.

117903.name: Madagascar Kartz
117903.description:
Madagascar Kartz is a racing game based on DreamWorks Animation's Madagascar. It was released on October 27, 2009 and the second game on Madagascar's spin-off series. The game uses the Wii Wheel, despite the cover.

The game is a basic kart racing game, and the player can perform jumps, flips, rolls. There are many different stages from scenes of the franchise. Playable characters include Alex, Marty, Gloria, Melman, King Julien, Mason and Phil, or all four of the penguins. The Madagascar Kartz Wheel is bundled with the Wii version of the game. This wheel is optional. This wheel's look is different from that of the Wii Wheel from Mario Kart Wii.
Playable characters include Alex the Lion, Marty the Zebra, Melman the Giraffe, Gloria the Hippotamus, The Penguins, The Chimps, and King Julien from the Madagascar. Two characters from other movies are included alongside the Madacascar, Shrek from Shrek, and B.O.B. from Monsters vs. Aliens, all Dreamworks franchises. Race types include Quick Race, Championship, Time Trial and Checkpoint race. A Championship race is one where the player collects mangoes and tries to finish first place in order to unlock higher speed classes (50cc, 100cc, 150cc, 200cc, the last one is raced in reverse direction/mirror mode), more karts and tracks. In Time Trial, players beat their own times and earn medals (gold, silver and bronze). In Checkpoint Race, players collect as many hourglasses as they can before the time runs out. There are several tracks in the game. Also, in a track, most tracks have 2 shortcuts. "I Like to Move It", sung by Reel 2 Real, is the menu theme. The game's gameplay is similar to those of Mario Kart Wii, by Nintendo.

Source: Wikipedia, "Madagascar Kartz", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

117906.name: Nouns in a Bag
117906.description:
A party game where teams take turns trying to guess nouns or phrases being described in increasingly limited fashion by a teammate.

At the beginning of the game each player writes five nouns or phrases on a slip of paper, which are all then shuffled into a bag. Players are divided into two teams, and one team is chosen to start. It is recommended the starting team alternate between rounds to reduce the starting advantage.

The first round is timed for 1 minute. The active team chooses someone to draw nouns from the bag, while the rest of the team tries to guess the noun. During this round the active player may say anything they like, as long as they do not say the words on the paper. Each correct guess is worth a point. Then, with all the drawn papers left out of the bag, the second team does the same.

The second round is timed for 2 minutes, and is played as the first round, except instead of speaking the active player may only perform charades.

The third round is timed for 1 minute, and is identical to the previous two except now the active player may only say one word.

117907.name: Sorcerer's Apprentice
117907.description:
User Summary

A game where Mickey Mouse, as the Sorcerer's Apprentice, tries to shoot and collect falling magical stars and objects.

117908.name: The Big Fat Tomato Game
117908.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Sink your teeth into this juicy game of fierce tomato farming!

In The Big Fat Tomato Game, you try to harvest the most tomatoes while defending your patch from a garden variety of intruders like weeds, varmints, and even the dastardly tomato zombie. Oh, and did we mention flying hippos?! Haul the most tomatoes to market by the end of the game and you're a slice above the competition!

117909.name: The Guild Companion (Jan 2012)
rpgissuearticle: Awem studio launches The Island: Castaway 2
The Art of Fighting Section 10: Vis - Part 2
117909.description: This page does not exist. You can edit this page to create it.

117910.description:
Schotten Rennen, part of a line of combined dice-and-card games that publisher AMIGO Spiel introduced in 2012, is all about strutting your stuff while competing in kilts!

In the traditional Highland Games, the Scots have to prove their worth in various disciplines such as rock throwing, log lifting and barrel rolling. During the evening celebration the heroes are celebrated with bagpipe music, dancing, and a few rounds of a fun dice game.

In Schotten Rennen, as in the Highland Games themselves, players also try to get from start to finish. Only this time they need to use dice to finish the course. Each challenge card must be overcome by using the dice. Your kilt and strength will not help here though. Here you need to take risks and hope for lots of luck.

Whoever completes the course first wins!
117910.name: Schotten Rennen

117911.name: Über Land und Meer
117911.description:
Objective: find as many of wanted nations/capitals as possible

- acting by turn/simple 'draw & place' geographic game -

Flip tiles upside down
Draw a tile (flag/capital) and find the corresponding place on the map(s)
6 different maps Africa, Asia, Australia and Oceania, Europe, North America & Central America, South America.
Remarks:
Version held by National Library of Australia dated 1890s.
The individual maps were subsequently updated, another version having maps showing borders as follows: South America ~ 1905, Africa ~ 1885, Europe ~ 1920.

117912.name: Druidenpost (Issue 1 - Oct 1985)
117912.description:
This issue contains two inofficial D&D adventuremodul "Die vergessene Höhle" and "In den Katakomben von Asdor".

In also contain rules addons für weapons and armor.

An article about the historic of some D&D cities and regions.
News & reviews.

117913.name: Grand Prix Story
117913.description:
Manage your own racing team and win the Grand Prix!

Source: The Game Website.

117914.description:
Game description from the publisher:

The settlement of the country is the work of the players in their role as noble builders in Milestones!

In this game, players work together to build roads, create marketplaces, and erect houses. With each milestone set along the way, they move further into the country.

But while they build together, when it comes to procuring construction materials, money, and grain each player is on his own. Thus, you must carefully develop your own network of goods, trade and colonization materials and optimize its use cleverly. Whoever also develops a keen sense of timing can grab the most valuable building sites and in the end win out.
117914.name: Milestones
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 26: Milestones, Our One Year Retrospective and Building Better PCs Part 2
Garrett's Games 329 - Milestones
OBG 92: Cult of the Old
The Game Pit: Episode 1 - Picking Over the Bones
The One About the Stronghold
The Spiel #163 - Robots & Rondels

117915.description:
Japan, 1605 – Hidetada Tokugawa has succeeded his father as the new Shogun, ruling from the great city of Edo (a.k.a. Yedo), the city known in present times as Tokyo. This marks the beginning of the golden age of the Tokugawa Shogunate and the so-called Edo Period that will last until 1868. Naturally, the most powerful families in Edo immediately try to curry favor with the new Shogun – and this is the opportunity our clan has been looking for, our chance at power and glory. Our clan will prove ourselves to be indispensable to the new Shogun. We will work from the shadows to acquire information about our rival clans. We will kidnap those who might oppose our ascent and assassinate those who prove a threat. We will use cunning to prevent our adversaries from doing the same to us. We will find glory and honor in the eyes of this new Shogun – or failing that we will end his rule by any means necessary.

In the strategy game Yedo, players assume the roles of Clan Elders in the city of Edo during the early years of the Tokugawa Shogunate. The object of the game is to amass Prestige Points, mainly by completing missions. To do so, players must gather the necessary assets and – most importantly – outfox their opponents and prevent them from completing their missions.

There are several ways to reach your goal. Will you try to complete as many missions as possible and hope that your efforts catch the Shogun's eye? Or will you choose a more subtle way of gaining power by trying to influence the Shogun during a private audience? You can also put your rivals to shame by buying lots of luxury goods from the European merchants. It's all up to you – but be careful to make the right choices, for in Yedo, eternal glory and painful disgrace are two sides of the same coin...
117915.name: Yedo
boardgamepodcastepisode: 7. Devon Dice Podcast, Quadropolis Review
Episode 110 - Keeping the PWM at a Constant Duty Cycle
Episode 13: Burke, Dirk, and Jerk
Episode 2 -- Yedo and the Japanese Word for Luck
Episode 21 -- Rant! Coffee! Tournament!
Garrett's Games 381 - Yedo and Essen Possibilities Part 1
Podcast #13: The Tale of Elfblow Whistleknife
The Game Pit: Episode 1 - Picking Over the Bones
The Game Pit: Episode 44 - Lobstercon
The Spiel #167 - Soy Sauce Samurai
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 26!!!
Yedo (eggertspiele / Pegasus): Spiele-Podcast Nr. 173

117917.description:
Earth - Present Day
The day started off so well for the humans, but then the sky darkened as a higher intelligence showed its face. These aliens are here to have a little fun, it's a race-to abduct the most humans. Can the humans strike back, or will the aliens have their way?

The Human Race is a competitive alien abduction game, a cooperative military defensive game, or both!

Alien Abduction
You and your alien opponents must move your spaceship pawns around the hex-filled game board to abduct the specific human target as indicated by the deck of target cards. While a player is abducting a human, opponents may move on to the next target or try to steal the human abductee from the alien abductor by attacking them. But look out! The humans aren't going to take this sitting down, the military is after you too. There are also bonuses to help you along on your journey. The alien with the most points when all the humans have been abducted wins!

Military Defensive
You will control the Earth denizens in a last-ditch effort to keep your peeps safe! Blast the heck out of the alien menace and end their sick game once and for all. Move jets and tanks around the board in order to quell the situation while moving human targets to safety. Rob the aliens of their prizes or their spaceships and save the day!
117917.name: The Human Race

117918.name: Spherechild: Grundregelwerk (1st edition)
117918.description:
These are the core rules for the german RPG Spherechild.

This book contains complete seting for 2 of the worlds:
- Valcreon (High Fantasy)
- Icros (Cyperpunk)

The special about the system is that the players have to act on both worlds with different chars which are connected by the spheres to defend their worlds. So each player can play more than one hero with differnt race, culture, ecperience, class etc. but they all have the same information.

Mainly included:
Rules for character generation,
two complette worlds (sphere),
rules for combat,
rules for magic and psionic,
rules for experience and leveling.

(user summary)

117919.name: 2012 Counterattack
117919.description:
"This is a war game that combined "Defense" and "RTS" Genre. You must create special and unique units to conquer the aliens' base.

Scenario:
- From the makers of 2012 Defense, we bring you 2012 Counterattack. This story happens after the predecessor 2012 Defense. The aliens invade aiming to re-dominate the earth with the powerful antimatter energy left from prehistory. The war doesn’t stop until human won the final war on Dec. 12, 2012. But this is not the end, you must lead your troop to wipe out all alien invaders entrenched in the United States of America.
- You can choose from a variety of devastating weapons as well as upgrade your armies and send troops. Listen to the death cries of aliens as you conquer their base.
- You must become a hero of human to save our homeland and wipe out the aliens.
- Stunning graphics and realistic sounds combine to create an immersive
experience.

Game Play:
-Tilt left or right: Adjust location of map or mini-map.
-Bottom button: Produce units

Special Characteristics:
-Attack enemies with the Assistance weapons armed on the base.
-Over 18 different types of units.
-10 different upgrades for US units and weapons related.
-50 numbers of stages(50 states)
-Online ranking system
-Several different troop types including war machines like M270 MLRS and EX-Basher."

Source: The Game Website.

117920.name: Spherechild: Sol Thu'ma
117920.description:
Sol Thu'ma is a new "galaxy" (sphere) for Spherechild with a sience fiction/horror setting. But this book not only contains this setting it also have new races, proffesion, weapons, equipment, creatures and rules for space combat.

The book also contains an adventure for the new worlds and the world from the core rules: Valcreon

it contains a full color map (A2) for the space system round Sol Thu'ma

(user summary)

117921.name: ADSudoku
117921.description:
"Sudoku is a logic-based,combinatorial number-placement puzzle. The objective is to fill a 9×9 grid with digits so that each column, each row, and each of the nine 3×3 sub-grids that compose the grid (also called "boxes", "blocks", "regions", or "sub-squares") contains all of the digits from 1 to 9. The puzzle setter provides a partially completed grid, which typically has a unique solution."

Source: Wikipedia, "Sudoku", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

117922.name: Battleground Defense
117922.description:
"Experience the classic tower defense game play along with the intense action of modern warfare.

Defend your territory using Missile Launchers, Heavy Cannons, Flame throwers in different landscapes around the world.

- 9 different maps
- 30, 50, 80 waves of enemy attack
- 18 different weapons to defend against enemies
- 15 different enemy units including air units"

Source: The Developer Website.

117923.name: Spherechild Abenteuerland: In der dunkelsten Stunde
117923.description:
This book contains 6 adventure in 3 parts. It also contains a complete village Fillertal as setting for the adventures on Valcreon.

The first 3 adventures are on Icros, the heroes have to fight against the drugsyndicate.

the next 3 adventure start on Valcreon where the time stood still and the heroes have to find out what happen, whitin the game they will find out that the Sphere Icros have some troube, too. Only if booth party of chars work together they will find out what really happen.

(user summary)

117924.name: Eisenbahn-Spiel
117924.description:
Objective: be the first reaching target space
- moving by turn -
simple 'Roll & Move' game
roll the die - ending on a marked space draw a card and follow instructions
remarks
huge board: 49 x 71.5 cm (19.3" x 28.1")
cover shows 3 well known mountains: Eiger, Mönch, Jungfrau.

117925.name: Party Pigs: Farmyard Games
117925.description:
Party Pigs: Farmyard Games, or simply referred to Party Pigs, is a party game for Wii developed by Destineer and published by UK-based game company Data Design Interactive. The game was first released in North America on April 28, 2009[1] and later in Europe on June 26, 2009.
Party Pigs is a compilation of nine self-explanatory track and field mini-games, including the 100m dash, 110m hurdles, long jump, high jump, hammer throw, javelin, 100m diving, high diving, and turnip toss. Activities related to speed have players shake the Wii remote and nunchuk, while those involving jumps or poses require players to perform quick swiping movements. Players can engage in either single events or collections of events in groups of up to four players. The game also contains are unlockable activities and group events.

Source: Wikipedia, "Party Pigs: Farmyard Games", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

117926.name: Spherechild: Introheft (1st edition)
117926.description:
user summary

This is the first-steps test book for the german RPG Spherechild.

This book contains a small overview of the gamesystem, the worlds, also included are 2 ready-to-use heroes. And a small solo-adventure.

on the last pages there are blanko sheets for two new heroes.

117927.description:
The Hunt: Carpathia, 1897 is a period specific tabletop adventure game, set in the dangerous monster-ridden land of Carpathia.

Players of The Hunt will take turns moving around the game board, fighting monsters, avoiding hazards, collecting bounties, and trying to kill one another - all while trying to find better weapons and gear. Ultimately they want to take down one of the unique Prey monsters, each of whom grants a unique ability to their vanquisher.

Weapons, items, monsters and hazards are all represented on detailed cards with unique art relevant (we hope) to the time period. Players roll dice (d8) to move and attack, using their own special abilities and items to their best advantage. Each player is one of 6 unique characters, each with different strengths.

Death in The Hunt is by no means final - when a player loses all vitality points (players start with and have a max of 3) he/she is turned into a "cursed" player, remains on the board with new abilities, and is now turned against the remaining live players. Nobody is ever "out of the hunt."

Players battle monsters and each other earning trophy points for each monster vanquished. A player must collect a certain number of trophy points and make it back to the ship for the win! If all players become cursed, the cursed player with the most trophy points wins.
117927.name: The Hunt: Carpathia, 1897

117928.name: Spherechild: Introheft (2nd edition)
117928.description:
This is the first-steps test book for the german RPG Spherechild.

This is for the 2nd edition which is published by Prometheus Games 2012

The book contains an overview of the gamesystem, rules for combat, races and the two worlds, also included are some ready-to-use heroes.
A first start adventure "Die magischen Armbänder" gives the players an overview of the gameplay on the two different worlds with the same goal.

The Introheft is free for download!

(user summary)

117929.description:
Game description from the publisher:

After a brutal conflict outside the gates of Moria, several of Middle-earth's heroes press forward, into the dark, Dwarven mines to scout the ancient tunnels for the source of the increased Orc activity in the Misty Mountains. The way is dark and choked with foes and hazards.

The Long Dark is the fourth Adventure Pack in the "Dwarrowdelf" cycle for The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game and adds 60 new cards including a new hero, three copies of each player card, and an all-new scenario that pits your heroes against bands of Goblins, the hazards of traveling in the dark, and the risk of getting lost. As your heroes travel through the Dark, Underground realm of Moria, they must navigate carefully or suffer the consequences of losing their way. Any wrong turn may result in disaster.

Note: A copy of The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game Core Set and the Khazad-dûm Expansion are required to play the scenario included in this Adventure Pack.
117929.name: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – The Long Dark
boardgamefamily: Lord of the Rings: The Card Game (LCG)

117931.name: Sopranos Trivia in a Box Board Game
117931.description:
This is the sequal to The Sopranos Trivia Game.

How well do you know Tony and the family? Yo, you betta know deez guys good if youz are gonna play. Now you and your friends can test your knowledge of the number one show on cable with The Sopranos Trivia Game. There are one thousand trivia questions that will challenge you on your knowledge of the program and "Mob Speak". Place bets on which questions you can answer correctly. Five levels of difficulty make it easy for even occasional viewers to play against dedicated fans of The Sopranos.

Game Includes: Vinyl Playing Surface 200 Trivia Cards Betting ChipsFor 2 or more adult players ages 18 and up.

117933.name: Sploink
117933.description:
The first dexterity game using the Shibumi set!

Players roll their marbles onto the board (using paper as a ramp) to score points and multipliers.

Who can Zing the pyramid?

(Note, it is recommended to play this only with the Ninja set. Game may damage marbles from the Samurai set.)

117934.name: Play Trays Sound & Sort Game
117934.description: Sound/picture matching game for 1 or 2 players. Players pick picture tiles and must deduce the first letter of the matching word. Supplied with non-competitive rules.

117935.name: Heinz Monopoly Game
117935.description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

Another in the very long line of MONOPOLY Games.

117936.name: River Plate
117936.description:
A Naval Game, British made with Prov Pat No 2649. "River Platte". produced by Victory Games during World War II. Features a large scaled down model of a ship along with some miniature ships in different colors used by the players as player pieces. Also is sort of a search board numbered from 1-100 where different spaces might produce attacks by the enemy.

From Ebayer daviddunne who I have contacted for more info about the game

117937.name: Tru-Action Horse Racing Game
117937.description: By Tudor. Game features vibrating base turned on by electricity. Line the horses up and watch them race around the track to see who crosses the finish line first. Bet on who wins the race.

117938.name: Major League Baseball Game
117938.description: By GABRIEL from the 1950's. A game featuring spinners and 6 plastic men. Spin the spinner to see what happens in the game

117939.name: Zentrum
boardgameversion: Spiele mit Stift und Papier edition
117939.description:
Paper-and-pencil game where from 2 to 4 players must score the most possible points by filling the 16 central spaces of an 8x8 board.

Each player starts from a corner of the board and marks with their own symbol (dot, circle, square or cross) a square two or three spaces away in a straight vertical or horizontal line from the square previously marked; a square can be marked by all players. The distance from one marked square to the next has got to be two squares on one turn, three in the next one, then two squares again, then three and so on (the player can choose which value goes first). A player can't land on a square already marked with their symbol.

The game ends when the 16 central squares of the board have been ticked. Players score for the central squares they have ticked: each square brings as many points as different symbols have been marked on the square.

117940.name: Alien Nations
117940.description:
User Summary

Alien Nations is a combination of real time and long view strategy, as you try to guide one of three races on an alien planet to prosperity before the others.

117941.name: Duke it out in D.C.
videogameexpansion: Duke Nukem 3D
117941.description:
From the back of the box:

The President of the U.S. has been kidnapped - It's up to Duke to set him free!

Aliens have captured the President! Duke gets word that alien scum have landed in Washington D.C., laid it to waste, and imprisoned the leader of the free world. Always up for a heroic deed, Duke heads to D.C. to rid the city of enemy dirtbags and return the president to power!

Features:


9 of the hugest, most incredible Duke levels ever! There's a 10th "Top Secret" level that we can't tell you about here. (clue: Duke goes back in time to an ancient world)



Duke It Out In D.C. guide - which gives you a mission briefing and level storyline



Award Winning Levels Creator - levels created by winner of TEN's best Duke Nukem 3D levels


Duke travels through the White House, Lincoln Memorial, FBI, Smithsonian, the Naval Institute, Capitol Building, Control Center, Subway System, D.C. Sewage, the Naval Weapons Plant, and much more!!!

boardgamehonor: 2013 Golden Geek Best Children's Board Game Nominee
117942.description:
Zooloretto: The Dice Game takes the basic Zooloretto / Coloretto game play – on a turn either add to the offerings on display, or take one set of offerings – and replaces the cards with dice so that you'll never know which animals will pop up for you to take. Each player has her own scoresheet, which represents her zoo, with space for five types of animals: one crocodile, two ostriches, up to five lions. The scoresheet also has space to collect coins and barns for animals that don't fit in the appropriate pens.

On a turn, the active player takes one of two actions:

Take two dice from the reserve, roll them, then assign each die to a transport cart on the game board.
Take all the dice in one transport cart, then tick off the animals/coins on those dice on your scoresheet.




Dice can be placed in separate carts, and the number of dice is limited to six, eight, or ten depending on the number of players. The round continues until each player has taken dice from a cart, then a new round begins. The first player to fill the pen of a particular type of animal receives a bonus; if a player takes more animals than she has room for, however, she ticks off the barn for each type of overflow animal.

The game ends once a player has filled all her animal pens or has space in only one pen. Players score one point for each animal and any bonus points they received; they lose two points for each barn ticked off, but for each group of coins collected, one penalty can be ignored. (Alternatively, coin groups are worth one point.) The player with the highest score wins!
117942.name: Zooloretto: The Dice Game

117943.name: Car Wars Internet Newsletter (Vol 14 No 2 - February 2011)
rpgissuearticle: AUTOMOTIVE COMBAT MEDIA - ELECTRONIC GAMES - COMPUTER
AUTOMOTIVE COMBAT MEDIA - ELECTRONIC GAMES - ONLINE
ROLEPLAYING GAMES - SAVAGE WHEELS SETTING FOR SAVAGE WORLDS
117943.description:
User Summary

In this issue: THE GUNNERY CHAIR, ARTICLES, ARTWORK, AUCTIONS, BOARD GAMES, BLOGS, BLOG POSTS, BOARDGAME EXPANSIONS, CONVENTION EVENTS, DISCUSSION FORUMS, DISCUSSION FORUM THREADS, GAMING GROUPS, INDEPENDENT AUTODUELLISTS, MAGAZINES, MINIATURES AND TERRAIN, PODCAST EPISODES, ROLEPLAYING GAMES, ROLEPLAYING GAMES - D20 MODERN ARCHIVE, ROLEPLAYING GAMES - SAVAGE WHEELS SETTING FOR SAVAGE WORLDS, SOCIAL MEDIA, WIKI ENTRIES, AUTOMOTIVE COMBAT MEDIA - GAMEBOOKS, AUTOMOTIVE COMBAT MEDIA - ELECTRONIC GAMES - COMPUTER, AUTOMOTIVE COMBAT MEDIA - ELECTRONIC GAMES - ONLINE, AUTOMOTIVE COMBAT MEDIA - FAN FICTION, AUTOMOTIVE COMBAT MEDIA - MOVIES, AUTOMOTIVE COMBAT MEDIA - VIDEO, BLASTS FROM THE PAST, THE CRACKED WINDSHIELD, & AUTODUELLING TECHNOLOGY TODAY.

117944.name: Battle Isle: The Andosia War
videogamepublisher: Blue Byte Software GmbH (Blue Byte Studio GmbH)
117944.description:
BATTLE ISLE®: THE ANDOSIA WAR is an entirely new kind of conflict simulation, combining elements of real-time and turn-based strategy in an action-packed mixture. The player is immersed in a complex world where both economic finesse and military expertise are essential. Powered by a revolutionarily new engine, the game is presented completely in 3D with an unprecedented richness of detail. In network game there can be up to 8 players on 2 teams. It is possible to play via Internet without any additional game fees on the BATTLE ISLE Internet server.

In the tradition of the BATTLE ISLE series, the tactical aspects of the game are carried out in turn-based mode. In contrast to a pure real- time strategy, this allows not only more game depth but also more lavish graphic effects, zooms and camera chases, immersing the player in every event. Light conditions change during the course of the day. The weather, the seasons and even the tides play a key role in producing goods and planning tactics and strategy. A core component of the strategy in THE ANDOSIA WAR involves securing the necessary resources and carefully planning how they are to be used. Raw materials must be collected; factories, research facilities and power plants have to be built and transportation systems have to be created. All of this, including the actions of the player, take place in real time and continue in the background while the player plans and sets up his military maneuvers.

Source: The Publisher Website.

117945.name: Car Wars Internet Newsletter (Vol 15 No 1 - January 2012)
rpgissuearticle: Classic Car Wars Products on e23
117945.description:
User Summary

In this issue: The Gunnery Chair, Special Features, Classic Car Wars Products on e23, Daily Illuminator Car Wars Posts, Articles and Independent Autoduellists, Gaming Groups, Games, Rulebooks and Supplements, Miniatures and Terrain, Blog Posts, Forum Discussions, Social Media, Artwork, Modeling Tips and Photo Galleries, Fan Fiction, Blasts from the Past, Console and Computer Games, Mobile Phone Games, Movies, Television Programs
Podcasts, Online Videos, Offline Web Sites, Obituaries, Autoduelling Technology Today, & The Cracked Windshield.

117946.name: Crusaders of Might and Magic
117946.description:
Crusaders of Might and Magic is a third-person action/RPG video game developed and published by 3DO's Austin, Texas studio (Playstation) and Redwood Shores studio (PC). Different versions of the game were released for both Microsoft Windows and the PlayStation. The protagonist Drake was voiced by veteran voice actor Kevin Conroy.

Source: Wikipedia, "Crusaders of Might and Magic", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

117947.name: Die by the Sword: Limb from Limb
videogameexpansion: Die By the Sword
117947.description:
User Summary

An expansion pack to the action sword fighting game Die by the Sword, which was released earlier the same year.

117948.name: Munch
117948.description:
Munch is a game about giant space monsters breaking into our dimension to eat worlds. Monsters also munch each other when they meet while floating through space.

Five Rainbow stashes of Looney Pyramids are required for two players to play. An additional Xeno stash allows up to four players. The game is played on a 6x6 board.

Players take turns placing worlds on the board. At any point players can unleash one of their monsters from their army to the board. Monsters continue to move on the board until they run out of worlds to munch or until they get munched themselves.

The goal of the game is to collect the most worlds, with single-colored trios scoring highest. The player with the highest score from trios and single worlds at the end of the game wins.

117949.name: Gildenbrief (Issue 16/17 - Jul 1989)
rpgpublisher: Verlag für Fantasy- und Science Fiction-Spiele
117949.description:
The first A4 issue as double magazine Nr. 16 & 17

This issue contains a new class "Zornbringer", article about the Spinnengöttin cult, new skills, an article about the druids and one article about mounts. "Die Harfe von Ilmach" a new magical artifact. And ten new spells.

117950.name: Spack
117950.description:
Spack is a two-player game for the Shibumi set.

The board is initially empty. Each player ownes 24 balls (8 white, 8 black, 8 red)

Players take turns adding one of their balls.
Under certain conditions, they can return balls to their supply too.

The game ends, as soon as a player can´t make a legal move.

The winner is determined by the number of balls, the players have left.

Spack is an entry in the Shibumi Challenge.

117951.name: Narrspelet
117951.description:
Old cardgame published in Sweden probably in the 40s or 50s.

You try to complete pair of two cards by taking one card from your neighbour. If you get a pair you put down the cards infront of you. The first one who get rids of all the cards win.

117952.name: Rising Tempest
117952.description:
From the publisher's website:

As the conflict against the Tau approaches its breaking point and paranoia over their suspected acts of sedition reaches an all-time high, the infamous Lord Commander Ebongrave seeks allies he can trust in his campaign against disloyalty. But are Tau sympathizers really maneuvering among the loyal citizens of the Imperium? And if so, what darker plans do they hold in store?

Rising Tempest is an adventure in three parts for Deathwatch! When the Tau make a play for dominance that threatens to tip the balance of power in the Canis Salient, they’ll unwittingly endanger the entire Jericho Reach... and only the Space Marines of the Deathwatch can stop them. This epic campaign is told in three parts, and takes players across the Canis Salient and into midsts of the Hadex anomaly:


The Depths of Treachery—The Kill-team travels to the iron heart of the Canis Salient to eradicate a subversive xenos presence imperiling the might of the Imperial war machine. But stirring in the chaos of sedition and catastrophy, they’ll stumble upon something much darker.
Assault on Javar Nil—Pursuing clues of an ancient evil, the Battle-Brothers find themselves caught between the factions of a holy schism on the shrine world of Eleusis. There, they must safeguard the blessed core of the Achilus Crusade.
Exterminatus—Struck at the very bastion of their power, the Kill-team must brave the horrors of the Hadex anomaly and return to a long-lost citadel to save their galaxy from utter ruin!

117953.name: Tims Tüftel-Team
117953.description:
The gift machine has broken down and has to be repaired! This is done by connecting the machine parts with a line of dominoes (standing up, so that they can be toppled, not lying down).

At the start of Tims Tüftel-Team, several cardboard tokens representing the machine parts are scattered along the table. The game is played in rounds; in each round, two tokens have to be connected. At the start of the first round, one token is selected as the starting token, and this also dictates which token will be the destination token. In later rounds, the destination token from the previous round becomes the starting token.

Now, the players take turns placing dominoes in the line from the start token to the destination token, building past any other tokens. Each turn, a player rolls a die, which allows him to add zero to three dominoes to the line. When the destination token is reached, the round ends. The player whose turn it is gets to topple the dominoes by pushing the first domino in the line. First, though, the other players have to predict whether or not the entire line of dominoes will fall.

After predictions have been made, the first domino is toppled. If the entire line falls, then the toppling player receives a gift token, as well as any player who made the right prediction; if some dominoes remain standing, the players who predicted that receive a gift token.

After six rounds, the game ends, and the player who has gained the most gift tokens wins.

In the expert version of the game, various contraptions for connecting two lines of dominoes are included, and in each round, one of these is included in the line of dominoes connecting the start and destination.

117954.name: Das Bibel Quiz
117954.description:
Objective: improve your knowledge about the Bible - Old & New Testament
- acting/moving by turn -
roll the die, move, draw a card, get the correct answer

117955.name: Das Quiz der Schlager & Volksmusik
117955.description:
Objective: move to finish line knowing correct answers on questions out of the world of German Schlager music
- moving/acting by turn -
roll the die, move forward, draw a correspondent card, find correct answer (out of 4 - multiple choice); questions like (samples):
Andrea Berg was married with? Adamo - which nationality?
Flippers, Peter Alexander, Kastelruther Spatzen ... songs, text

content: 1 board - 2 different maps, 110 cards, 6 meeples, 2 Joker-meeples, 1 die, rules

117956.name: Gildenbrief (Issue 18 - Jan 1990)
rpgissuearticle: Korrekturen zu MIDGARD, Das Fantasy Rollenspiel 3. Ausgabe. Frühjahr 1989
rpgpublisher: Verlag für Fantasy- und Science Fiction-Spiele
117956.description:
This issue contains an article of a part of magic "Thaumaturgen"
and magic in Waeland (region). A new skill for Midgard: fencing.
The first part of the region description of TsaiChen-Tal.

117957.name: Gildenbrief (Issue 19 - Apr 1990)
rpgissuearticle: Das TsaiChen-Tal - Zweiter und letzter Teil
rpgpublisher: Verlag für Fantasy- und Science Fiction-Spiele
117957.description:
The main focus of this issue is music. So it contains articles about singing/chanting music instruments magic artifact. magic spells with music.
It also contains the second part of the region description TsaiChen-Tal and a new first part for the settlement Skadre Huldre in Waeland.

117958.name: Gildenbrief (Issue 20 - Jul 1990)
rpgpublisher: Verlag für Fantasy- und Science Fiction-Spiele
117958.description:
This issue has its main focus on magic. Articles about the mage and their universities/academia. And 9 new magical spells.

It also contains some ideas for new adventures (with magical background) and the second part of the settlement Skadre Huldre.

boardgameimplementation: The Heaven Sword and Dragon Saber
boardgamehonor: 2012 Golden Geek Best Family Board Game Nominee
2012 Golden Geek Best Party Board Game Nominee
2012 Japan Boardgame Prize U-more Award Nominee
2013 Årets Spel Best Adult Game Winner
117959.description:
Developer Stefan Brück at alea describes Las Vegas as "an easy, dice-rolling, fun-and-luck game with a lot of interaction and 'schadenfreude'". Who doesn't love schadenfreude? (Well, other than those being schadened, I suppose...)

In more detail, Las Vegas includes six cardboard casino mats, one for each side of a normal six-sided die. For each mat, players draw money cards until at least $50k is showing, but the amount may end up being a lot more, making that casino more desirable.

Each player has eight dice of a different color, which they take turns rolling. When you roll your dice, you can choose to place them on the relevant casino cards; for example, a die showing a 1 will be placed on the casino mat marked "1". You must place all dice of one number on one casino in your turn. All players take turns doing this until all the dice have been used. Finally, the player with the most dice on each casino card takes the money associated with it. In case of a tie, the next non-tied player takes the highest-valued money card at that casino.

Las Vegas rates a 1 out of 10 on alea's difficulty scale.
boardgameversion: Multilingual second edition with "Spiel des Jahres"  Logo
117959.name: Las Vegas
boardgamepodcastepisode: #45: Six-Player Six Pack; Las Vegas on tap; Barcelona; Mystic Vale; Betrayal at the Brewery on the Hill
ba002 – Mit mächtigem Badabum ins Fledermausland
BGA Episode 100 - Top 100 Games of All Time
DJ32: Las Vegas (2012) Rüdiger Dorn
Episode 72 March Craziness Dice Game Style Part 1
Episode 82-- LIVE from Gen Con 2014 Part 1
Episode 97-- March Madness Filler Tournament
Garrett's Games 321 - Targi, Vegas, IOS Games, and SdJ/KdJ Winners
The Game Pit: Episode 65 - Short Games with Mark Johnson
The One About Auld Lang Syne
The One About Culling and Critics
The Spiel #155 - Spiel des Schpiel 2012 - Part 2
Vegas (alea / Ravensburger): Spiele-Podcast Nr. 142
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 80
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 82
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 85!

117960.description:
Developer Stefan Brück at alea describes Saint Malo as "a light, dice-rolling strategy game in which the players draw their own city buildings, walls, and people on wipe-off boards".

In more detail, in Saint Malo players roll five dice to gain various resources; combinations of dice create enhancements like characters or buildings, which can provide additional victory points, money, or special actions, such as altering the outcome of a die roll. Players draw symbols for their holdings on erasable boards showing a grids of their cities to create individual towns. Players could build storehouses on particular squares, for example, then place a merchant nearby to gain money each turn. Another important character is the soldier; players must acquire these to defend themselves from pirate attacks that can decimate their towns.

Saint Malo rates a 2 out of 10 on Alea's difficulty scale.
117960.name: Saint Malo
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 6: Bruges/Gaming Pet Peeves
Garrett's Games 338 - Dominare, Spectaculum, and Saint Malo
Programa 011. Haritz Solana, de Asmodee. Saint Malo y Smash Up!
The Spiel #173 - Sim Chitty
There's No Such Thing as a Cool Cup

117961.name: Whizzers
117961.description:
Immerse yourself in the great adventure of Whizzers!

Discover a magical world of deadly traps, hungry monsters and bubbling lava. Find lost followers to gain companions which will give you dozens of special powers, and catch kidnappers to rescue other Whizzers. Customize your character and play against your friends in a great, up to 4 players, online multiplayer arena mode.

Source: The Publisher Website.

117962.name: Hero Princess
117962.description:
Become the princess in a mission to defend the castle from vikings invasion.

SOMETIMES THE GREATEST ARMY OF VIKINGS IS NOT ENOUGH

Furious vikings try to get into the castle by walking up the walls on ladders. Use castle bricks to knock off lightweight enemies, and shake the ladder to eliminate heavy ones.

MASSIVE SPECIAL WEAPONS

The princess has prepared some painful surprises for every viking in this dreadful army. Piano, bath or pony can easily eliminate multiple vikings at once.

MAKE YOUR CASTLE UNBREACHABLE

Efficient defense leads to high scores. Share your record on Game Center, and make use of wise defense strategy to become the best castle defender vikings have ever seen.

Source: The Developer Website.

117963.name: Bike Baron
117963.description:
User Summary

Prove your prowess on a motorbike as the Bike Baron. Roll, flip, tumble, and fly your way through over 100 levels while collecting stars and pushing for better times. Included is a level editor and the ability to download user created levels.

117964.name: Chocohero
117964.description:
Stop, drop, and roll right into an action-packed world of luscious sweets in Chocohero!

Smoresdom, the land of sweets and chocolate, is in danger! Cakems, guards of Smoresdom, hold Chocobits as prisoners. Chipster, the wobbly chocolate hero, stumbles in to help his Chocobit friends escape. Simply tilt your device left and right to guide Chipster as he rolls down to save his friends.
Bump the Cakems to crumble them and free the Chocobits!
Help Chipster's friends escape the emprisonment of cakes and crackers before it's too late. Use boosts and tornado skills to crush downwards and freeze time to stop the quickmilk pouring in from above.

Free all his friends and save Smoresdom!

Source: The Developer Website.

117965.name: Josef und seine Brüder
117965.description:
Objective: learn as much as possible about the story of 'Josef', written in the Old Testament;
improve your knowledge, communication, memory...
- acting by turn -
During your turn draw a card and follow instructions ==> you have to tell a story either by drawings, pantomimic,... explaining terms like 'wine', 'christening', 'Adam' in a way that all others can guess successfully what you've tried to describe.
successful - next players turn
otherwise draw a new card
remarks:
often an adult/game master reads a story prior to the start or at least supervises the activity

117966.name: Minions
117966.description:
Tiny hordes. Massive fun.

Jump into the world of Minions, playing as a mad scientist whose rebellious minions are trying to overthrow you. The clever minions you created to take over the world have decided that they should be in charge–and all heck has broken loose! Unleash your all-purpose Electro-gun, melee Hammer, Sound Wave blaster, and powerful Bird Launcher to mow down villainously cute minions through 8 action-packed FPS levels!

Pick up and play First Person Shooter fun!
Three classes of twistedly cute, cartoony minions to vanquish
Earn ability points to build Speed, Stamina, and Power
Four mad scientist weapons: versatile Electro-Gun, Melee Hammer, Sound Wave blaster, and mighty Bird Launcher
Use your special mind control attack to confuse minions

Take out all the minions and their spawn stations to clear each level as fast as you can to earn Game Center Achievements and perfect three-star ratings as you build up your skills such as speed, stamina, and power and unlock three ramping levels of difficulty. Small, fast Melee minions swarm you with mallets, Sound Wave minions hit you with short-range blasts, and Bird Launcher minions fire explosive birds at you… Take them all out to become the master of Minions!

Source: The Developer Website.

117967.name: Midgard Herold (Issue 1 - Oct 2000)
117967.description:
The first issue contains an article about the "typical" game session. An article about the cult of the god Laverna and one article about the order of the holy speer. Main part of the issue is the adventure "Turney von Adhelstan"

Description of two magical artifacts and an article about the black shaman from Medijs. Review of new Midgard source and adventure books. And two new creatures.

117968.name: Suomirokkia trivia 2
117968.description:
A trivia game about Finnish rock music from the 70's to 00's. The game includes a four-piece game board, 1000 questions, 30 pictures and a cd. The cd contains music samples. The publisher is a Finnish record company.

Players answer a question from their space and can advance if they answer correctly. A maximum of 2 advancements in one turn.

117970.name: The NetHack Board Game: Gnomish Mines Expansion
117970.description:
The Gnomish Mines expansion for the NetHack Board Game adds a new area, new encounters, and new play strategies to the base game.

Descend into the Gnomish Mines and return with gemstones that can be used throughout the Dungeons for an extra measure of luck, to bribe monsters, or to bid for items found by your opponent - unless they turn out to be worthless pieces of glass!

Note that this is an expansion, and requires the NetHack Board Game (v2.0) in order to play.

117972.name: Phoenix Campaign Rules
117972.description:
User Summary:

Rules for the Phoenix Campaign of Omega LRP.

117973.name: Pferdekoppel
boardgameversion: Spiele mit Stift und Papier edition
117973.description:
Paper-and-pencil game where from 2 to 4 players must move on an 8x8 board as Chess knights - used spaces will be unavailable for the rest of the game. The last player who's able to move wins. It's more or less an adaptation of Alex Randolph's Knight Chase for several players.

Each player has got an own symbol (dot, circle, square, cross) and starts from one corner on the board; before anyone moves each player will fill in a square on the board, which will be unavailable from then on (it's not allowed to block a player before their first move). Players then move in turn following the rules for a Chess knight, ticking the corresponding free space on the board with their symbol and filling in the square they departed from. If a player can't move the turn will be forfeited. The last player who can move wins the game.

117974.name: One Can Have Her
117974.description:
From the introduction:

A game in black-and-white inspired by film noir. Driven men in a dark underworld trying to stay alive long enough to set things straight. The Police Chief's daughter seducing them all, but only one can have her. If one of them rats on the others he gets the girl and peace of mind, but the rest of them die. If two of them rat, there are no winners.

117975.description:
Impact City Roller Derby ( ICRD ) is a fast paced board game for 2 or 4 players based on flat track roller derby.

Game play is done by moving your team of 5 roller derby girls around the board trying to get your Jammer to pass more opposing derby girls than your opponents Jammer.

Games should take between 90 minutes to 2 hours if you play all the possible Jams. The game uses strategic movement of your players to pass or block opposing players. A variety of dice (D6, D8, D10 and D12) are used to determine the success of key moves but dice rolling is kept to a minimum during a turn (normally moving all 5 players should only require 0 to 3 dice rolls).

In addition, each lap of the track the coach (ie you) will have a hand of 3 special move cards which will give you options for special offensive or defensive plays straight from normal flat track derby play (like a Leg Whip or Hip Check). There are also Foul cards which allow you to risk breaking the rules to give your team a key advantage, however the referee might catch you and send you to the penalty box.

Game play was kept true to the rules for the sport of flat track roller derby, while also trying to make the game fast paced and fun.
117975.name: Impact City Roller Derby

117976.name: German Dungeon
117976.description:
In-Game Instructions

Welcome, brave German student...

You must survive the dangers of the dungeon and retrieve the treasure.

To do this, you must perform various exercises with the German language.

Monsters and traps are cleverly hidden in the dungeon!

Beware the dead ends--break down walls only when you must! You can only break a limited amount!

At the end of the game you will receive a quiz of the questions you answered incorrectly.

User Summary

German Dungeon is a German language quiz game set in a fantasy dungeon setting. The game may be played in three modes - translating verbs from German to English, from English to German (with or without gender), and a drill on perfect infinitives.

Two other options are selected by the player - skill level (difficulty) and dungeon levels (depth). Five difficulty levels are offered. The easiest level features no monsters or traps. The dungeon may be from two to eleven floors deep.

To win the game the player must descend to the bottom of the dungeon, retrieve the treasure, and return to the dungeon exit on the top floor. The random dungeon floors are graphically displayed in a top-down view. The player must correctly answer the German language quiz questions in order to open doors, avoid traps, break down walls and battle monsters.

Three stats are displayed at the end of the game: the elapsed time, the number of questions missed in the dungeon, and the number of questions missed in the post-game quiz.

117977.name: Faeries of the Fringe
117977.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Welcome to Faeries of the Fringe, the tenth in our Mythic Menagerie line of monster books. Each volume in this line presents a small set of monsters tied to a single theme, but spread over a range of CRs. For Faeries of the Fringe that theme is fey folk who dwell off the mainstream (and are often tied to niche environments the way more common fey are tied to trees and forests). As an added bonus, author Sam Hing has put together an awesome set of fey-related magic items, spells, and feats to round out your wicked wise women.

While fey are classically considered to be most dryads and fauns, perhaps knights of some otherworldly Fairy Court, there are many cases of spirits tied to specific locations or ideas from mythology that could be considered to be "fey" in rules terms. This product looks at both some examples of such creatures in mythology and some niches common to fantasy roleplaying game campaigns, and posits what kinds of faeries would be attached to them. The end result is a whole new set of foes ranging in power from CR 2 (the glade maiden) to CR 10 (the river mother), ready to force the PCs to fight, flee, or negotiate.

So stay out of the fairy-rings, put some milk out on the sill, and keep your cold iron handy. The charnel-kin are stirring, the nightswans are counting their tribute, and the river mothers are always on the lookout for new husbands.

117978.name: Alcatraz Harry
117978.description:
User Summary

In this game you'll have to escape the Alcatraz prison. You'll do that in three levels, or phases:
First you'll have to get the needed equipment.
If you succeed in that, you'll have to negotiate a minefield and
finally you'll have to steal a car.

Game is an action game, but negotiating the minefield involves some color coded puzzling.

117979.name: The Investigator
117979.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The investigator is a searcher for answers, a solver of riddles, and an explorer of the unknown. While many investigators fall into the broad category of “detective,” the class can be used to represent anyone skilled at gathering information, forming theories, and applying knowledge gained in new and innovative ways. Reporters who seek to uncover the truth, scientists who wish to discover the fundamental laws of nature, inventors who want to create new devices, and even physicians who seek to understand diseases and heal the sick are all examples of investigators. Investigators apply knowledge and intelligence the way warriors apply brute force, as their primary tool in overcoming challenges. In so doing, they are often able to solve an extremely broad range of problems.

Of course investigators are often asking questions others would prefer go unanswered. Such inquiries can make enemies, and often have consequences. Occasionally tracking down murderers in the dark alleys of Whitechapel, deciphering Babylonian books bound in human skin, experimenting with alien technology, or asking too many questions about mysterious cults, create such bizarre consequences the investigators end up in fantasy realms where the mysteries are far more deadly, and the resources at their disposal much more primitive.

The “modern” person of great education and intellect being stuck in a more primitive, fantasy-themed world is a common trope in a great deal of adventure fiction, especially the “time travel adventure fiction” more common in the early part of the 20th century than today, but still very popular with a wide range of gamers (and game writers). The investigator is the second in a line of Anachronistic Adventurers products designed to provide rules for running modern (or near-modern) heroes in a typical fantasy roleplaying game setting. While it’s impossible to address every possible issue that might arise for such characters (can the adherent of a modern, real-world religion become a cleric?), each product in the line will look at one area where the modern and fantasy realms are most likely to overlap and give guidance for running heroic anachronisms.

We also discuss some rules useful in dealing with the detective tropes common to fiction in a number of genres, including gathering clues, preventing investigations from taking over a campaign, making sure a bad die roll never brings a mystery adventure to a total standstill, and the advantages of advanced scientific knowledge. Finally we touch on the idea of Progress Levels (PL), a simple way to determine the general technological advancement of a campaign (and outlined in more detail in Anachronistic Adventurers: The Enforcer).

117980.name: Alcatraz II: The Doomsday Mission
117980.description:
User Summary

This game picked up where part I ended. After escaping Alcatraz Harry is now in possession of the enemy plans to destroy the world; the Doomsday Plans. Harry must get these plans to the Allies by helicopter. But to get to the helicopter, he must cross a great deal of jungle, collect diamonds, trade with inhabitants, get information from fellow escaped prisoners and more

117981.name: 7 Time Thief & Time Warden Feats
117981.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Sometimes rules supplements read like the world-setting bible of frustrated novelists. While solid world-building is a useful skill, you don’t always need four paragraphs of flavor text to tell you swords are cool, magic is power, shadows are scary, and orcs are savage. Sometimes a GM doesn’t have time to slog through a page of history for every magic weapon. Sometimes all that’s needed are a few cool ideas, with just enough information to use them in a game. Sometimes, all you need are bullet points.

#1 With A Bullet Point is a line of very short, cheap PDFs each of which gives the bare bones of a set of related options. It may be five spells, six feats, eight magic weapon special abilities, or any other short set of related rules we can cram into about a page. Short and simple, these PDFs are for GMs and players who know how to integrate new ideas into their campaigns without any hand-holding, and just need fresh ideas and the rules to support them. No in-character fiction setting the game world. No charts and tables. No sidebars of explanations and optional rules. Just one sentence of explanation for the High Concept of the PDF, then bullet points.

The High Concept: Seven feats designed to augment the options and utility of time thieves and time wardens (from The Genius Guide to the Time Thief and The Genius Guide to the Time Warden).).

The feats included are:


Aevum Mastery
Alternate Self
Last-Second Save
Mote Mastery
Opportune Blow
Precognition
Timely Detonation

117982.name: At Neuve Chapelle
117982.description:
At Neuve Chapelle provides a tactical re-play of the World War I battle. The British attempted to reduce a poorly-defended German salient centered on the town of Neuve Chapelle. Plans were to expand a breakthrough and with cavalry and infantry reserves take the Aubers ridge line. However, poor communication and coordination and the weather conspired to slow the initial British successes and allowed the German army to rush reinforcements into the area. Among other game features, designer Michael W. Kennedy uses offensive artillery and defensive artillery fire, British command checks, and a unique assault combat mechanic to simulate the bloody struggle. (Sourced from the White Dog Games website.)

The game is played over a series of 14 turns which represent the three days of The Battle of Neuve Chapelle. Each day is divided into four turns with a separate night turn in between. During the day turns, both sides will fire artillery (weather permitting), move, and attack. During the night turns, both sides will dig in new trenches on the new front lines.

The game simulates early trench warfare and makes prominent use of artillery and the defensive advantages of trenches. Weather conditions and British communications among the four divisions are determined randomly each turn. Each assault phase contains a defensive artillery and defensive combat phase, making defense a major component of the game.

There are several hexes that have victory point values. The British win by controlling as many of these hexes as possible. The Germans win by preventing the British from achieving this objectives.

117984.name: The One True King
117984.description:
The King is dead and three powerful Lords vie for the throne. They will use everything in their power to win (Military Power, Allies, Knights, Nobles, Spies, the church, mercenaries, whatever it takes). Although 3 contend for the crown, in the end there can only be ONE TRUE KING!

In the game, each player plays out 3 columns of cards consisting of Knights, Nobles, Allies, and Army units. The total strengths of the columns are compared. Then, Intrigue Cards are played to change the balance of power. Intrigue Cards include assassinations, bribery, desertions, reserves, etc. The final column strengths are revealed and the player who wins 2 of the 3 columns is the victor.

117985.description:
Star Trek: Catan takes two well-known media properties and merges them into, well, into something that is 95% The Settlers of Catan glossed with Trek tropes and spiced with a Trek-themed version of a mini-expansion previously only available in German.

In Star Trek: Catan, players start the game with two small Outposts at the intersection of three planets, with each planet supplying resources based on the result of a dice roll. Players collect and trade these resources – dilithium, tritanium, food, oxygen and water – in order to build Starships that connect regions in the galaxy, establish more Outposts and Starbases (upgraded Outposts) at new intersection points in order to increase resource acquisition, and acquire Development Cards that provide Victory Points (VPs) or special abilities.

On a dice roll of 7, a Klingon ship swoops in to prevent resource production on one planet while taxing spacegoers who hold too many resources.

Star Trek: Catan differs from the basic Settlers in one aspect: a set of Support Cards formerly available only in German as Catan Scenarios: Helpers of Catan. Each Support Card features a special ability and one of Kirk, Spock, McCoy, Sulu, Scott, Uhura, Chekov, Chapel, Rand, or Sarek. Some special abilities make basic actions better, such as reducing the costs of Starbase upgrades or allowing the player to trade a resource of their choice at 2:1 for a turn, while others break rules, such as protecting the player from discarding on a 7 or producing a resource when the player rolls a number that wouldn't otherwise produce for them. Players get a specific Support Card during setup based on turn order, with later players getting generally more useful abilities to compensate for early player advantage. When a player uses a Support Card ability for the first time, they may trade it in for a Support Card of their choice or keep it for a second use, but they may only trade immediately after use.
117985.name: Star Trek: Catan
boardgameaccessory: Star Trek: Catan – Victory Point Displays
